member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1LinkTargetFile.FileName
member.summary: Specifies the file or object on which to execute the specified verb.
member.remarks: To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name. Note that not all verbs are supported on all objects. For example, not all document types support the "print" verb.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1LinkTargetFile.Command
member.summary: Gets the command (verb) specifying the action to perform when the link is clicked.

remarks.para: The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs.
For more information about verbs and their availability, see Object Verbs. See Extending Shortcut Menus for further discussion of shortcut menus.
The following verbs are commonly used.

list.item: edit Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

item.description: Explores the folder specified by FileName.
Initiates a search starting from the specified directory.
Opens the file specified by the FileName parameter. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder.
Prints the document file specified by FileName. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

For systems prior to Microsoft? Windows? 2000, the default verb is used if it is valid and available in the registry. If not, the "open" verb is used. For Windows 2000 and later systems, the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1LinkTargetFile.Parameters
member.summary: If the parameter specifies an executable file, this is a string specifying the parameters to be passed to the application. The format of this string is determined by the verb that is to be invoked. If specifies a document file, this should be an empty string.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Document.C1CaretCoords
member.summary: Defines position of caret within a text. Position defined via 2 points: - position on the top of the text line, - position on the bottom of the text line. For normal horizontal english text Min.X == Max.X and Max.Y == Min.Y + HeightOfTheTextLine. For text rotated on 90 degrees Max.X == Min.X + HeightOfTheTextLine, Min.Y == Max.Y. If text is rotated on some NOT right angle then Min.X != Max.X and Min.Y != Max.Y.

member.summary: For internal use. Abstract class representing the full context in which a operates. Instances of this class can be used to save and restore the current state of a C1DocumentSource, for example it can be used to implement forward and backward navigation. For details see and methods. member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Document.C1DocumentSource
member.summary:
Abstract base class for types that can create and manage a object from some source.
Derived classes provide implementation for specific sources such as SSRS reports etc.
The common base (C1DocumentSource) allows to work with various document and reports types (e.g. previewing or printing them) in a uniform manner.

member.summary: Extended Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code_128_A
member.summary: Code 128 A uses control characters, numbers, punctuation, and upper case.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code_128_B
member.summary: Code 128 B uses punctuation, numbers, upper case and lower case.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code_128_C
member.summary: Code 128 C uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code_128auto
member.summary: Code 128 Auto uses the complete ASCII character set. Automatically selects between Code 128 A, B and C to give the smallest barcode.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code_2_of_5
member.summary: Code 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code25intlv
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Codabar
member.summary: Numeric only, slightly denser than Code39.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Matrix_2_of_5
member.summary: Matrix 2 of 5 is a higher density barcode consisting of 3 black bars and 2 white bars. Matrix_2_of_5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.MSI
member.summary: MSI Code uses only numbers.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.PostNet
member.summary: Numeric only, US Postal Service.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.EAN_13
member.summary: EAN-13 uses only numbers (12 numbers and a check digit). If there are only 12 numbers in the string, it calculates a checksum and adds it to the thirteenth position. If there are 13, it validates the checksum and throws an error if it is incorrect.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.EAN_8
member.summary: EAN-8 uses only numbers (7 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.UPC_A
member.summary: UPC-A uses only numbers (11 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.UPC_E0
member.summary: UPC-E0 uses only numbers. Used for zero-compression UPC symbols. For the Caption property, you may enter either a six-digit UPC-E code or a complete 11-digit (includes code type, which must be 0 (zero)) UPC-A code. If an 11-digit code is entered, the Barcode control will convert it to a six-digit UPC-E code, if possible. If it is not possible to convert from the 11-digit code to the six-digit code, nothing is displayed.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.UPC_E1
member.summary: UPC-E1 uses only numbers. Used typically for shelf labeling in the retail environment. The length of the input string for U.P.C. E1 is six numeric characters.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RM4SCC
member.summary: Royal Mail RM4SCC uses only letters and numbers (with a check digit). This is the barcode used by the Royal Mail in the United Kingdom.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.UCCEAN128
member.summary: UCC/EAN –128 uses the complete ASCII character Set. This is a special version of Code 128 used in HIBC applications.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.QRCode
member.summary: QRCode is a 2D symbology that is capable of handling numeric, alphanumeric and byte data as well as Japanese kanji and kana characters. This symbology can encode up to 7,366 characters.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Code49
member.summary: Code 49 is a 2D high-density stacked barcode. Encodes the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.JapanesePostal
member.summary: This is the barcode used by the Japanese Postal system. Encodes alpha and numeric characters consisting of 18 digits including a 7-digit postal code number, optionally followed by block and house number information. The data to be encoded can include hyphens.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.Pdf417
member.summary: Pdf417 is a popular high-density 2-dimensional symbology that encodes up to 1108 bytes of information. This barcode consists of a stacked set of smaller barcodes. Encodes the full ASCII character set. Capable of encoding as many as 2725 data characters.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.EAN128FNC1
member.summary: EAN128FNC1 is a UCC/EAN-128 (EAN128) type barcode that allows you to insert FNC1 character at any place and adjust the bar size etc, which is not available in UCC/EAN-128. To insert FNC1 character, set “\n” for C#, or “vbLf” for VB to Text property at runtime.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSS14
member.summary: RSS14 is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSS14Truncated
member.summary: RSS14Truncated is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus Indicator digits for use on small items, not for point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSS14Stacked
member.summary: RSS14Stacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14Truncated, but stacked in two rows when RSS14Truncated is too wide.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSS14StackedOmnidirectional
member.summary: RSS14StackedOmnidirectional is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14, but stacked in two rows when RSS14 is too wide.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSSExpanded
member.summary: RSSExpanded is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus AI element strings (expiration date, weight, etc.) for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSSExpandedStacked
member.summary: RSSExpandedStacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSSExpanded, but stacked in two rows when RSSExpanded is too wide.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.RSSLimited
member.summary: RSS Limited is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification with indicator digits of 0 or 1 in a small symbol that is not scanned by point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.DataMatrix
member.summary: Data Matrix is a high density, two-dimensional barcode with square modules arranged in a square or rectangular matrix pattern.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.MicroPDF417
member.summary: MicroPDF417 is two-dimensional (2D), multi-row symbology, derived from PDF417. Micro-PDF417 is designed for applications that need to encode data in a two-dimensional (2D) symbol (up to 150 bytes, 250 alphanumeric characters, or 366 numeric digits) with the minimal symbol size.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.BarCodeEnum.IntelligentMail
member.summary: Intelligent Mail, formerly known as the 4-State Customer Barcode, is a 65-bar code used for domestic mail in the U.S.

member.summary: Gets .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the character encoding scheme: ASCII, UTF7, UTF8, or Unicode. The default value is UTF8.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the target output is for Excel. The default value is true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.FieldDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the delimiter string to put in the result. The default value is a comma ",".

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.FileExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets the file extension to put on the result. The default value is .CSV.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.NoHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the header row is excluded from the output. The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.Qualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the qualifier string to put around results that contain the field delimiter or record delimiter. If the results contain the qualifier, the qualifier is repeated. The Qualifier setting must be different from the FieldDelimiter and RecordDelimiter settings. The default value is a quotation mark (").

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.RecordDelimiter
member.summary: Gets ot sets the record delimiter to put at the end of each record. The default value is <cr><lf>.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.SuppressLineBreaks
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating whether line breaks are removed from the data included in the output. The default value is false. If the value is true, the FieldDelimiter, RecordDelimiter, and Qualifier settings cannot be a space character.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.CsvExporter.UseFormattedValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether formatted strings are put into the CSV output. null indicates default value true when ExcelMode is true; otherwise it is false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.PdfExporter.HumanReadablePDF
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the PDF document should be created uncompressed, which allows the PDF source to be human-readable. This property is used only when is true. The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.PdfExporter.ServerSide
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the export is executed on the server side. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If this property is false, then the PDF file will be generated locally using C1Pdf. This mode provides more features which are supported by C1Pdf, including PDF/A, security settings etc. But, this mode is slower, and it does not support outlines.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.PdfExporter.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fonts used in the report should be embedded in the generated PDF. This property is used only when is false.
member.remarks: Embedding the fonts can make the resulting PDF document substantially larger, but allows the document to be viewed correctly on systems that may not have all the necessary fonts installed.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.PdfExporter.PdfACompatible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the generated PDF file should be PDF/A compatible. This property is used only when is false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.PdfExporter.UseCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the generated PDF file should use compression. This property is used only when is false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.Ssrs.PdfExporter.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: Gets a PdfSecurityOptions object which specifies who can use the PDF document and what actions are allowed. This property is used only when is false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.PdfFilter.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Specifies whether the filter should embed font information into the PDF output.

remarks.para: Embedding font information makes the PDF document substantially larger, but it allows the file to be viewed faithfully in systems that don't have all the necessary fonts installed.
Embedding fonts is not necessary if the target systems have the necessary TrueType fonts installed.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.PdfFilter.UseOutlines
member.summary: Specifies whether the PDF output should include an outline tree.

remarks.para: The outline tree is created automatically based on the report groups and can be used to navigate through the report in the Adobe Acrobat viewer.
Each node in the tree corresponds to a group header section in the report. Invisible group header sections do not generate outline entries in the PDF document.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Export.TiffFilter.Monochrome
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the TIFF document should be saved in monochrome format.

remarks.para: The default value for this property is true, which results in much smaller documents that are compatible with fax machines (the compression used is CompressionCCITT4).
Set this property to false to generate color documents which use LZW compression but are substantially larger than monochrome documents (often 100 times larger using the same resolution).

member.summary: Renders a run of glyphs.
member.param: The X coordinate of the glyphs' baseline, if this is right-to-left text then X points to the "right" side of the text, glyphs should be drawn from this point to the left.
The Y coordinate of the glyphs' baseline, if range.IsSideways is true, i.e. glyphs should be drawn in vertical direction (japanese text), then Y equals to the middle of the glyphs' height.
The count of the glyphs.

The pointer to the array of shorts containing indicies of the glyphs in the font specified by the range.GetFontFace(), use ((short*)glyphIndices)[i] to get i-th glyph index, all indices already resolved and can not be zero.
The pointer to the array of floats containing the glyphs' widths, use ((float*)glyphAdvances)[i] to get width of the i-th glyph.
The pointer to the array of structures, use ((DW.GlyphOffset*)glyphOffsets)[i] to get width of the i-th glyph.
The pointer to the table of text clusters.
The color of the text.
The interface which allows to get extended information about text.
The object calling this method.
The text to drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1PrintOptions.PageSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the PageSettings object defining the page settings (page size, orientation and so on). This can be null in which case will be used. This property does not force C1DocumentSource to repaginate, it only affects the printer's paper size. The document's pages will be scaled to fit it.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1PrintOptions.PageScaling
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value indicating the manner in which pages are scaled during printing.
The default value is .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1PrintOptions.ImagesScaleFactor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale factor used to scale images before printing.
Low resolution images that need to be sized up to fit the target physical bounds can be scaled either by the printer driver, or by . When this property is 1 (the default), all scaling is done by the printer.On some printers this can lead to visible distortions.To avoid this, set this property to a value greater than 1 (e.g. 2, 3 or 4), which will cause to scale the image before sending it to the printer, and may help reduce the distortions.The specific value depends on the printer, and can be selected by trial and error.
Note that this does not affect the final printed size of the image, it only controls how the image is resized.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.C1PrintOptions.OutputRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the object defining the range of pages to print. This can be null in which case values specified in will be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name for the print job.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.BarcodeSizeOptions.ModuleSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the barcode module size in twips.
Zero means the default value which is different for different barcode types:
15 twips for simple "bar" barcodes.
75 twips for matrix barcodes (QRCode, DataMatrix).
45 twips for RSS stacked barcodes (RSSStacked, RSSExpandedStacked).
45 twips for composite barcodes.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.AssignNonInheritedFrom(C1.Win.C1Document.Style)
member.summary: Copies to the current style all properties of another object that have been explicitly set on that other style, plus the values of the and properties.
member.param: The source object to copy properties from.
member.remarks: Effectively, this method makes the current a complete copy of the style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner of the current style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.Parent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the that is the parent of the current style.
If non-null, that style provides the values for non-ambient properties of the current style that have not been explicitly set.
If null, such properties have default values.
This property is null by default.
member.remarks: Initially a object does not have any explicitly set properties. This means that the effective values of all ambient properties (such as font) are inherited from the style of the containing object, while the effective values of all non-ambient properties (such as borders) are inherited from the style specified by this property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.Parents
member.summary: Sets both parents ( and ) to the same value.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.Children
member.summary: Gets the collection of child styles (i.e. objects that have their set to the current style).
member.remarks: This method always returns a non-null collection of child styles, initializing it if it did not exist. To test whether a style already has child styles without creating the collection, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.HasChildren
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current style's collection has been initialized and contains one or more elements.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.AmbientParent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the that is the ambient parent of the current style.
If non-null, that style provides the values for ambient properties of the current style that have not been explicitly set.
If null, such properties are inherited from the style of the containing object.
This property is null by default.
member.remarks:
Initially a object does not have any explicitly set properties. This means that the effective values of all ambient properties (such as font) are inherited from the style of the containing object, unless this property has been set to a non-null value, in which case they are inherited from that style.
Note that even if an AmbientParent has been specified, only ambient properties that have been explicitly set on that style or any of its own ambient parents (styles or containing objects) propagate to the current style. See example below for details.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image. The image is aligned using .
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is no image.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.BackgroundImageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the background image in on the current document.
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is emtpy string.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.Brush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to fill the background. If both this and properties are specified for a style, the BackColor takes precedence.
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is no brush.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.Style.ForeColor

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder
member.summary: Holds a Graphics object together with (printer) device or bitmap that was used to create it, if any. The point is to dispose the device or bitmap together with the graphics when it is no longer needed (i.e. to avoid resource leaks).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.Empty
member.summary: An empty graphics holder instance.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the current graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the current graphics holder.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.Graphics
member.summary: Gets the graphics object held by the current instance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.DpiX
member.summary: Gets the horizontal resolution of graphics held by the current instance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.DpiY
member.summary: Gets the vertical resolution of graphics held by the current instance.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.FromDevice(C1.Win.C1Document.MeasurementDevice,System.String,C1.Win.C1Document.MeasurementDevice@,System.String@)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a printer or screen device contexts, depending on passing parameters. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the device context are released (DeleteDC is called on the device context). If is null or specifies invalid printer name then printer will be autoselected from list of available printers, if no printers are installed then method will be called.
member.param: The type of device to use (printer or screen).
The name of the printer.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.FromDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a device context. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the device context are released (DeleteDC is called on the device context).
member.param: The device context from which graphics is created.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.FromGraphics(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a graphics instance. When the holder is disposed, the graphics is left alone (i.e. NOT disposed).
member.param: The graphics to store in the new holder.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.FromScreen
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from screen. If that fails (e.g. on Azure), the graphics is created from a bitmap. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the bitmap are released.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Document.GraphicsHolder.FromBitmap
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a bitmap. The graphics and the bitmap are released when the holder is disposed. This should never fail.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.summary: The utility class which handles localization tasks.

member.name: M:C1.Win.Localization.StringsManager.GetC1BuiltinResourceStream(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Returns ResourceStream for "official" resources that provided only by C1, typicallly those resources contains design-time strings. Those resources can be only in main control assembly like C1.C1Preview.2.dll and name of resource should have following format: CulturePrefix.StringsTypeName for example: ja.C1.C1Preview.Design.DesignStrings.resx

member.name: M:C1.Win.Localization.StringsManager.GetResourceStream(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for standard resources which looks like BlaBla.Strings.CultureName.resx, like C1.Win.C1Preview.Strings.zh.resx or C1.Win.C1Preview.Strings.resx etc. Ensures that resource is not *C1* built-in resource, i.e. its name DOES NOT HAVE format like CultureName.BlaBla.Strings.resx, otherwise bug can occur if entry assembly have C1 builtin resources as in case of C1 executables like C1ThemeDesigner or C1FlexReportDesigner. For example C1ThemeDesigner have ja.C1ThemeDesigner.Strings.resx resource and this resource *SHOULD BE IGNORED* if resouceName is "C1ThemeDesigner.Strings.resx" and cultureName is "" (invariant).

member.name: M:C1.Win.Localization.StringsManager.GetParentCulture(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the parent of the CultureInfo passed in. Differs from ci.Parent in that while ci can be equal to ci.Parent, this method it never returns the passed ci itself, rather it would return null. Also this function has special handling for chinese culture. Under NET2 it returns "zh" culture name for neutral "zh-Hans" and "zh-Hant" chinese cultures, under NET2 "zh" is not exists.
member.param: The culture name to get parent for.
member.returns: The parent of the culture info, or null.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Win.Win32.MONITORINFOEX
member.summary: The MONITORINFOEX structure contains information about a display monitor. The GetMonitorInfo function stores information into a MONITORINFOEX structure or a MONITORINFO structure. The MONITORINFOEX structure is a superset of the MONITORINFO structure. The MONITORINFOEX structure adds a string member to contain a name for the display monitor.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.Win32.MONITORINFOEX.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the structure. Set this member to sizeof(MONITORINFOEX) (72) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.Win32.MONITORINFOEX.rcMonitor
member.summary: A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.Win32.MONITORINFOEX.rcWork
member.summary: A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor that can be used by applications, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Windows uses this rectangle to maximize an application on the monitor. The rest of the area in rcMonitor contains system windows such as the task bar and side bars. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.Win32.MONITORINFOEX.Flags
member.summary:
The attributes of the display monitor.
This member can be the following value: 1 : MONITORINFOF_PRIMARY

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.Win32.MONITORINFOEX.szDevice
member.summary: A string that specifies the device name of the monitor being used. Most applications have no use for a display monitor name, and so can save some bytes by using a MONITORINFO structure.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.
So the solution is this:

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Nag(System.Type,C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Nag user by showing AboutBox with license information. Show it only once per day per assembly.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
object that contains information about the license.
Whether we're running at design or run time.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object.
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
Any valid C1 runtime key.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

member.summary: Design time validation. Looks for a license in the registry and saves it in the provided .
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.
member.remarks: Call this method from application-type products (that always require a license to be installed in the registry). In this case, the parameter should be set to null.

member.summary: Runtime validation. Looks for a runtime key stored in the current application's resources.

where the runtime key will be stored.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.SafeLicenseContext
member.summary:
Provides a version of GetSavedLicenseKey that doesn't require special permissions.
The code was mostly copied from the .NET framework, but then changed in a few places to require fewer permissions (assembly name, file io, etc).
The main change is the use of a custom deserializer to read Hashtable objects instead of the original BinaryFormatter, which requires permissions.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1ProductInfoAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to attach licensing/product information to assemblies.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.ProductLicense
member.summary:
Represents a license for a product (e.g. C1BarCode, C1Studio Enterprise).
Provides methods for: - generating new license keys (administrative task) - checking license key validity (used by installer and products) - generating and checking runtime keys (used by products) - installing/uninstalling licenses (used by installer)
The install/uninstall code requires elevated permissions, and is used only by setups and utilities (not by controls). The code is implemented in the ProductLicense.Installer.cs, which controls should not include since it won't be useful to them.
When a product is sold, we send the user a license KEY. The user installs a license on his machine by providing his name, his company name, and the key.
The is a string in the following format:
AAQYYCC-XX-NNNNNN-DD-DZZZZZZ
Where:
AA: Product code (should match one of the products in the product catalog (see ProductInformation.GetProductCatalog()). Q: Quarter when the license key was issued (1, 2, or 3) YY: Year when the license key was issued (e.g., 10 for 2010) CC: Order code, two chars that indicate whether this is a new sale, upgrade, renewal, special offer, etc. XX: Hash code to ensure key validity. NNNNNN: Unique serial number. DDD: Vendor code, three chars ZZZZZZ: Combination of random numbers for uniqueness and extra hash.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode
member.summary: Defines the method of mixing the colors with the backdrop (source and destination colors).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: This is the default attribute which specifies no blending.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary:
The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.
The resultant color is always at least as dark as either the source or destination color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary:
Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.
The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.
Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary:
Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.
The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary:
Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.
The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary:
Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary:
Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.
The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary:
Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.
The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary:
Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary:
Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary:
Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.
Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Color
member.summary:
Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.
This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary:
Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.
This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel
member.summary: Specifies the color channel to operate on.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Blue
member.summary: The Blue channel is chosen.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Green
member.summary: The Green channel is chosen.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Red
member.summary: The Red channel is chosen.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Alpha
member.summary: The Alpha channel is chosen.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode
member.summary: Specifies the Porter Duff compositing method in which two pixels (source and destination) may contribute to the final color of the pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Clear
member.summary: No regions are enabled.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Copy
member.summary: Only the source will be present.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Destination
member.summary: Only the destination will be present.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceOver
member.summary: Source is placed over the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationOver
member.summary: Destination is placed over the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceIn
member.summary: The source that overlaps the destination, replaces the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationIn
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source, replaces the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceOut
member.summary: Source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationOut
member.summary: Destination is placed, where it falls outside of the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceAtop
member.summary: Source which overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. Destination is placed elsewhere.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source replaces the source. Source is placed elsewhere.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.XOR
member.summary: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Lighter
member.summary: Display the sum of the source image and destination image.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method of two-dimensional error diffusion dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.NoDithering
member.summary: Don't spread the error to neighbor pixels.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.FloydSteinberg
member.summary: Floyd-Steinberg dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.JarvisJudiceNinke
member.summary: Jarvis, Judice, and Ninke filter.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Stucki
member.summary: Stucki dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Atkinson
member.summary: Bill Atkinson's formula.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Burkes
member.summary: Burkes dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Sierra
member.summary: Frankie Sierra's dithering algorithm (sometimes called Sierra-3).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.TwoRowSierra
member.summary: Simplified two-row Sierra algorithm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.SierraLite
member.summary: Sierra Lite dithering.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction
member.summary: Specifies the flip and rotation transformations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.None
member.summary: No transformation.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.Rotate90
member.summary: A clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.Rotate180
member.summary: A clockwise rotation of 180 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.Rotate270
member.summary: A counter-clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipHorizontal
member.summary: A horizontal flip. Pixels are flipped around the vertical y-axis.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipHRotate90
member.summary: A horizontal flip, then a clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipHRotate270
member.summary: A horizontal flip, then a counter-clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipVertical
member.summary: A vertical flip. Pixels are flipped around the horizontal x-axis.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod
member.summary: Indicates the way in which the GIF frame has to be treated after being displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.NotSpecified
member.summary: No disposal specified. The decoder is not required to take any action.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.DoNotDispose
member.summary: Do not dispose. The graphic is to be left in place.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.RestoreToBackgroundColor
member.summary: Restore to background color. The area used by the graphic must be restored to the background color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.RestoreToPrevious
member.summary: Restore to previous. The decoder is required to restore the area overwritten by the graphic with what was there prior to rendering the graphic.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard
member.summary: Specifies the standard used for converting full-color image to monochromatic gray.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT601
member.summary: Corresponds to the standard color TV and video systems such as PAL and NTSC.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT709
member.summary: Correspoinds to the ITU-R BT.709 standard used for HDTV.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT2100
member.summary: Correspoinds to the ITU-R BT.2100 standard for HDR television.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Specifies the sampling or filtering mode to use when scaling an image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: A nearest neighbor interpolation algorithm. Also known as nearest pixel or point interpolation.
member.remarks: The output pixel is assigned the value of the pixel that the point falls within. No other pixels are considered.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Linear
member.summary: A bilinear interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: The output pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest four pixels in a 2x2 grid. For downscaling by factors greater than 2 use the Downscale interpolation mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Cubic
member.summary: A bicubic interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest sixteen pixels in a 4x4 grid. For downscaling by factors greater than 2 use the Downscale interpolation mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Downscale
member.summary: A resampling algorithm for downscaling by factors greater than 2.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the all the pixels that map to the new pixel.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode
member.summary: Specifies the different methods by which two regions can be combined.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Union
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the union of both.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Intersect
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking their intersection.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the area that exists in the first region but not the second and the area that exists in the second region but not the first.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Exclude
member.summary: The second region is excluded from the first.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression
member.summary: Compression scheme used for encoding TIFF image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.DontCare
member.summary: Indicates a suitable compression algorithm based on the image and pixel format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.NoCompression
member.summary: No compression, but pack data into bytes as tightly as possible, leaving no unused bits (except at the end of a row).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.CCITT_1D
member.summary: CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run length encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Group_3_Fax
member.summary: T4-encoding: CCITT T.4 bi-level encoding as specified in section 4, Coding, of CCITT Recommendation T.4: “Standardization of Group 3 Facsimile apparatus for document transmission.”

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Group_4_Fax
member.summary: T6-encoding: CCITT T.6 bi-level encoding as specified in section 2 of CCITT Recommendation T.6: “Facsimile coding schemes and coding control functions for Group 4 facsimile apparatus.”

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.LZW
member.summary: An adaptive compression scheme for raster images.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Deflate
member.summary: Deflate compression, using zlib data format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.PackBits
member.summary: A simple byte-oriented runlength scheme.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation
member.summary: The orientation of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.TopLeft
member.summary: Normal horizontal (default).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.TopRight
member.summary: Mirror horizontal.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.BottomRight
member.summary: Rotate 180 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.BottomLeft
member.summary: Mirror vertical.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.LeftTop
member.summary: Mirror horizontal and rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.RightTop
member.summary: Rotate 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.RightBottom
member.summary: Mirror horizontal and rotate 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.LeftBottom
member.summary: Rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult
member.summary: Specifies whether an image can be loaded from TIFF frame and the reason if it can't.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.Success
member.summary: No problems found. Image can be loaded from a .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.IncompatibleCompressionScheme
member.summary: CCITT_1D, Group_3_Fax, and Group_4_Fax compression schemes are only supported for SamplesPerPixel = 1 and BitsPerSample = 1.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.MissingColorMap

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap
member.summary: Represents an uncompressed in-memory bitmap in 32-bit ARGB format (A is the most significant byte).

member.summary: Initializes an empty instance of the class.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class and creates the image.
The image content is not initialized and can contain any random data.
If subsequent rendering is going to cover the whole surface of the bitmap, or if will be called on the bitmap with a non-null background color, clearing it (which is a lengthy operation for large bitmaps) is not needed. If some areas of the bitmap are going to be left untouched, they must be cleared to avoid the possibility of random artifacts showing.
member.param: The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
Indicates whether the alpha channel should be ignored.
The horizontal dpi of the image.
The vertical dpi of the image.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.MathF.Atan2(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the angle whose tangent is the quotient of two specified numbers.
member.param: The y coordinate of a point.
The x coordinate of a point.
member.returns: An angle, θ, measured in radians, such that -π≤θ≤π, and tan(θ) = y / x, where (x, y) is a point in the Cartesian plane. Observe the following: For (x, y) in quadrant 1, 0 < θ < π/2.For (x, y) in quadrant 2, π/2 < θ≤π.For (x, y) in quadrant 3, -π < θ < -π/2.For (x, y) in quadrant 4, -π/2 < θ < 0.For points on the boundaries of the quadrants, the return value is the following:If y is 0 and x is not negative, θ = 0.If y is 0 and x is negative, θ = π.If y is positive and x is 0, θ = π/2.If y is negative and x is 0, θ = -π/2.If y is 0 and x is 0, θ = 0. If x or y is , or if x and y are either or , the method returns .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.COM
member.summary: The text comment marker

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s) marker
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags
member.summary: Line-breaking and justification conditions; East Asian width category for the code point.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates that none of the flags are set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.GraphemeStart
member.summary: Indicates the start of a Grapheme Cluster.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.WordStart
member.summary: Indicates the start of a word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.Sideways
member.summary: Whether the glyphs are rotated on their side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.UprightIfTransformed
member.summary: Indicates if characters should be displayed upright if transformed with the 'vert' or 'vrt2' GSUB features.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.SidewaysIfNotTransformed
member.summary: Combination of the Sideways and UprightIfTransformed flags.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.Whitespace
member.summary: Indicates that the character is some form of whitespace, which may be meaningful for justification.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.Tabulation
member.summary: Indicates the character tabulation.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.TabOrWhitespace
member.summary: Bit mask for the character tabulation and whitespaces.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.InlineObject
member.summary: Indicates that the character is a replacement for inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.MayNotBreak
member.summary: Indicates that there should be no line break after this code point.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.CanBreak
member.summary: Indicates that a line break is allowed after this code point.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.MustBreak
member.summary: Indicates that the line break must happen after this code point.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.BreakAfterMask
member.summary: Mask for testing the line-breaking behavior.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.LineSeparator
member.summary: Indicates that the character is a line separator (0x2028). It doesn't not cause a paragraph break.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.KeepWithNext
member.summary: Indicates that the character is a paragraph separator (0x2029). It prevents a page break between paragraphs (GC specifics).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.Arabic
member.summary: The Arabic script.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.HiddenWhitespace
member.summary: A non-pritable whitespace character.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.AmbiguousWidth
member.summary: Ambiguous characters

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.Narrow
member.summary: East Asian Narrow

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.Wide
member.summary: East Asian Wide (and emoji)

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.NeutralWidth
member.summary: Neutral (Not East Asian)

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CodePointFlags.WidthMask
member.summary: Mask for testing East Asian character width category.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags
member.summary: Provides additional information on the glyph.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.None
member.summary: No additional info.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.ClusterStart
member.summary: Indicates that the glyph is the start of a cluster.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.RunStart
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph is at the start of a code point run.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.GsubRunStart
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph is at the start of a GSUB glyph run.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.GposRunStart
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph is at the start of a GPOS glyph run.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.BreakGposContext
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph is at the start of the new GPOS context.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.Vertical
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph should appear upright with vertical reading direction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.Sideways
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph should appear rotated 90 or -90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.NoKerning
member.summary: Prevents glyph kerning when its reading direction is unnatural.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.XN
member.summary: Non-joining glyph form that does not join on either side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.XR
member.summary: Right-joining glyph form.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.XL
member.summary: Left-joining glyph form.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.XM
member.summary: Dual-joining (medial) glyph form that joins on both left and right.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.ArabicJoiningMask
member.summary: Mask for testing Arabic joining glyph forms.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.IsInlineObject
member.summary: Indicates if an inline object should appear instead of the glyph.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.IsTab
member.summary: Indicates if the glyph represents a tabulation character.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.RomanBaseline
member.summary: The baseline used by simple alphabetic scripts such as Latin, Cyrillic and Greek.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.IdeographicBaseline
member.summary: The baseline used by ideographic characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.MathBaseline
member.summary: The baseline about which mathematical characters are centered.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.HangingBaseline
member.summary: The hanging baseline from which syllables seem to hang in Tibetan and other scripts.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.BaselineMask
member.summary: The bit mask for the baseline values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.OtherClass
member.summary: Unclassified or Component glyph.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.BaseClass
member.summary: Base glyph class (single character, spacing glyph).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.LigatureClass
member.summary: Ligature glyph class (multiple character, spacing glyph).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.MarkClass
member.summary: Mark glyph class (non-spacing combining glyph).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.ClassMask
member.summary: The bit mask for determining glyph class.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.NoAdvance
member.summary: The glyph is not visible and has no advance.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.TabWithAlignment
member.summary: Indicates if the character tabulation has additional alignment options.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphFlags.EmulatedUpright
member.summary: Indicates if normally sideways character should be drawn upright in vertical text.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition
member.summary: Chooses the relative horizontal position for an anchored object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.CharCenter
member.summary: The object center coincides with the anchor character's (line's) center.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.CharLeftIn
member.summary: The object left side coincides with the anchor character's (line's) left side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.CharLeftOut
member.summary: The object right side coincides with the anchor character's (line's) left side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.CharRightIn
member.summary: The object right side coincides with the anchor character's (line's) right side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.CharRightOut
member.summary: The object left side coincides with the anchor character's (line's) right side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.MarginLeft
member.summary: The object left side coincides with the left margin of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.MarginCenter
member.summary: The object center coincides with the layout box center.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HorizontalPosition.MarginRight
member.summary: The object right side coincides with the right margin of the layout box.
