member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FlowDirection
member.summary: Indicates the direction of how lines of text are placed relative to one another.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FlowDirection.HorizontalTopToBottom
member.summary: Specifies that horizontal text lines are placed from top to bottom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FlowDirection.VerticalRightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies that vertical text lines are placed from right to left.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FlowDirection.VerticalLeftToRight
member.summary: Specifies that vertical text lines are placed from left to right.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontCompressionLevel
member.summary: Specifies the method of font compression in the font atlas.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontCompressionLevel.Store
member.summary: No compression is performed on the source font.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontCompressionLevel.Fast
member.summary: Fast compression using the standard compression algorithm from System.IO.Compression.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontCompressionLevel.Default
member.summary: Better compression and relatively fast decompression.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass
member.summary: IBM Font Class and Subclass represent a classification of font-family design.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.NoClassification
member.summary: Indicates that the associated font has no design classification or that the design classification is not of significance to the creator or user of the font resource.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.ClassMask
member.summary: A bit mask to extract the Font Class from the combined value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.OldstyleSerifs
member.summary: This style is generally based upon the Latin printing style of the 15th to 17th century, with a mild diagonal contrast in stroke emphasis (lighter in upper left to lower right, heavier in upper right to lower left) and bracketed serifs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_IBMRoundedLegibility
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with short ascenders and descenders. Specifically, it is distinguished by a medium resolution, hand tuned, bitmap rendition of the more general rounded legibility subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_Garalde
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with tall ascenders. An example of this font style is the ITC Garamond family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_Venetian
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with a relatively monotone appearance and sweeping tails based on the designs of the early Venetian printers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_ModifiedVenetian
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with a relatively monotone appearance and sweeping tails based on the designs of the early Venetian printers. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Palatino family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_DutchModern
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with wedge shaped serifs and a circular appearance to the bowls similar to the Dutch Traditional Subclass below, but with lighter stokes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_DutchTraditional
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with wedge shaped serifs and a circular appearance of the bowls. An example of this font style is the IBM Press Roman family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_Contemporary
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a small x-height, with light stokes and serifs. An example of this font style is the University family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_Calligraphic
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by the fine hand writing style of calligraphy, while retaining the characteristic Oldstyle appearance.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Oldstyle_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Oldstyle Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.TransitionalSerifs
member.summary: This style is generally based upon the Latin printing style of the 18th to 19th century, with a pronounced vertical contrast in stroke emphasis (vertical strokes being heavier than the horizontal strokes) and bracketed serifs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Transitional_DirectLine
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with fine serifs, noticeable contrast, and capitol letters of approximately the same width. An example of this font style is the Monotype Baskerville family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Transitional_Script
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a hand written script appearance while retaining the Transitional Direct Line style. An example of this font style is the IBM Nasseem (Arabic) family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Transitional_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Transitional Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.ModernSerifs
member.summary: This style is generally based upon the Latin printing style of the 20th century, with an extreme contrast between the thick and thin portion of the strokes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Modern_Italian
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with thin hairline serifs. An example of this font style is the Monotype Bodoni family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Modern_Script
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a hand written script appearance while retaining the Modern Italian style. An example of this font style is the IBM Narkissim (Hebrew) family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Modern_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Modern Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.ClarendonSerifs
member.summary: This style is a variation of the Oldstyle Serifs and the Transitional Serifs, with a mild vertical stroke contrast and bracketed serifs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Clarendon
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs and strokes of equal weight. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Clarendon family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Modern
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs of a lighter weight than the strokes and the strokes of a lighter weight than the Traditional. An example of this font style is the Monotype Century Schoolbook family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Traditional
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs of a lighter weight than the strokes. An example of this font style is the Monotype Century family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Newspaper
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with a simpler style of design and serifs of a lighter weight than the strokes. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Excelsior Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_StubSerif
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with short stub serifs and relatively bold stems. An example of this font style is the Cheltenham Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Monotone
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with monotone stems. An example of this font style is the ITC Korinna Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Typewriter
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with moderate stroke thickness characteristic of a typewriter. An example of this font style is the Prestige Elite Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Clarendon_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Clarendon Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.SlabSerifs
member.summary: This style is characterized by serifs with a square transition between the strokes and the serifs (no brackets).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Slab_Monotone
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs and strokes of equal weight. An example of this font style is the ITC Lubalin Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Slab_Humanist
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with serifs of lighter weight that the strokes. An example of this font style is the Candida Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Slab_Geometric
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs and strokes of equal weight and a geometric (circles and lines) design. An example of this font style is the Monotype Rockwell Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Slab_Swiss
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs and strokes of equal weight and an emphasis on the white space of the characters. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Serifa Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Slab_Typewriter
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with serifs and strokes of equal but moderate thickness, and a geometric design. An example of this font style is the IBM Courier Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Slab_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Slab Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.FreeformSerifs
member.summary: This style includes serifs, but which expresses a design freedom that does not generally fit within the other serif design classifications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Freeform_Modern
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with light contrast in the strokes and a round full design. An example of this font style is the ITC Souvenir Family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Freeform_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Freeform Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.SansSerif
member.summary: This style includes most basic letter forms (excluding Scripts and Ornamentals) that do not have serifs on the strokes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_IBMNeoGrotesqueGothic
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a large x-height, with uniform stroke width and a simple one story design distinguished by a medium resolution, hand tuned, bitmap rendition of the more general Neo-grotesque Gothic Subclass. An example of this font style is the IBM Sonoran Sans Serif family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_Humanist
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a medium x-height, with light contrast in the strokes and a classic Roman letterform. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Optima family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_LowXRoundGeometric
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a low x-height, with monotone stroke weight and a round geometric design. An example of this font style is the Fundicion Tipograficia Neufville Futura family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_HighXRoundGeometric
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a high x-height, with uniform stroke weight and a round geometric design. An example of this font style is the ITC Avant Garde Gothic family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_NeoGrotesqueGothic
member.summary: This style is generally characterized by a high x-height, with uniform stroke width and a simple one story design. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Helvetica family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_ModifiedNeoGrotesqueGothic
member.summary: This style is similar to the Neo-grotesque Gothic style, with design variations to the G and Q. An example of this font style is the Allied Linotype Univers family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_TypewriterGothic
member.summary: This style is similar to the Neo-grotesque Gothic style, with moderate stroke thickness characteristic of a typewriter. An example of this font style is the IBM Letter Gothic family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_Matrix
member.summary: This style is generally a simple design characteristic of a dot matrix printer. An example of this font style is the IBM Matrix Gothic family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Sans_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Sans Serifs design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Ornamentals
member.summary: This style includes highly decorated or stylized character shapes that are typically used in headlines.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Ornamentals_Engraver
member.summary: This style is characterized by fine lines or lines engraved on the stems. An example of this font style is the Copperplate family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Ornamentals_BlackLetter
member.summary: This style is generally based upon the printing style of the German monasteries and printers of the 12th to 15th centuries. An example of this font style is the Old English family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Ornamentals_Decorative
member.summary: This style is characterized by ornamental designs (typically from nature, such as leaves, flowers, animals, etc.) incorporated into the stems and strokes of the characters. An example of this font style is the Saphire family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Ornamentals_ThreeDimensional
member.summary: This style is characterized by a three dimensional (raised) appearance of the characters created by shading or geometric effects. An example of this font style is the Thorne Shaded family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Ornamentals_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Ornamentals design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts
member.summary: This style includes those typefaces that are designed to simulate handwriting.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_Uncial
member.summary: This style is characterized by unjoined (nonconnecting) characters that are generally based on the hand writing style of Europe in the 6th to 9th centuries. An example of this font style is the Libra family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_BrushJoined
member.summary: This style is characterized by joined (connecting) characters that have the appearance of being painted with a brush, with moderate contrast between thick and thin strokes. An example of this font style is the Mistral family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_FormalJoined
member.summary: This style is characterized by joined (connecting) characters that have a printed (or drawn with a stiff brush) appearance with extreme contrast between the thick and thin strokes. An example of this font style is the Coronet family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_MonotoneJoined
member.summary: This style is characterized by joined (connecting) characters that have a uniform appearance with little or no contrast in the strokes. An example of this font style is the Kaufmann family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_Calligraphic
member.summary: This style is characterized by beautifully hand drawn, unjoined (non-connecting) characters that have an appearance of being drawn with a broad edge pen. An example of this font style is the Thompson Quillscript family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_BrushUnjoined
member.summary: This style is characterized by unjoined (non-connecting) characters that have the appearance of being painted with a brush, with moderate contrast between thick and thin strokes. An example of this font style is the Saltino family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_FormalUnjoined
member.summary: This style is characterized by unjoined (non-connecting) characters that have a printed (or drawn with a stiff brush) appearance with extreme contrast between the thick and thin strokes. An example of this font style is the Virtuosa family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_MonotoneUnjoined
member.summary: This style is characterized by unjoined (non-connecting) characters that have a uniform appearance with little or no contrast in the strokes. An example of this font style is the Gilles Gothic family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Scripts_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Scripts design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Symbolic
member.summary: This style is generally design independent, making it suitable for Pi and special characters (icons, dingbats, technical symbols, etc.) that may be used equally well with any font.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Symbolic_MixedSerif
member.summary: This style is characterized by either both or a combination of serif and sans serif designs on those characters of the font for which design is important (e.g., superscript and subscript characters, numbers, copyright or trademark symbols, etc.). An example of this font style is found in the IBM Symbol family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Symbolic_OldstyleSerif
member.summary: This style is characterized by a Oldstyle Serif IBM Class design on those characters of the font for which design is important (e.g., superscript and subscript characters, numbers, copyright or trademark symbols, etc.). An example of this font style is found in the IBM Sonoran Pi Serif family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Symbolic_NeoGrotesqueSansSerif
member.summary: This style is characterized by a Neo-grotesque Sans Serif IBM Font Class and Subclass design on those characters of the font for which design is important (e.g., superscript and subscript characters, numbers, copyright or trademark symbols, etc.). An example of this font style is found in the IBM Sonoran Pi Sans Serif family.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFamilyClass.Symbolic_Miscellaneous
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous designs of the Symbolic design class that are not covered by another Subclass.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFallbackScope
member.summary: Restricts the set of available fallback fonts for a .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFallbackScope.Default
member.summary: Search fallback fonts in the custom font collection, then search in the system fonts.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFallbackScope.FontCollectionOnly
member.summary: Search fallback fonts in the custom font collection only, if any specified.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFallbackScope.None
member.summary: Do not search for the font fallbacks.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags
member.summary: Various flags describing the font.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.None
member.summary: No flags are set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.PostScript
member.summary: Indicates if the font contains PostScript outlines.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Compressed
member.summary: Indicates if the font is in WOFF format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.CannotEmbed
member.summary: Indicates if the font is prohibited for embedding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.CannotSubset
member.summary: Indicates if the font can not be serialized as a subset of the source font data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.FixedPitch
member.summary: False if the font is proportionally spaced, True if the font is not proportionally spaced (i.e. monospaced).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Vertical
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if this is a vertical font.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Italic
member.summary: Font contains italic or oblique characters, otherwise they are upright.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Bold
member.summary: Characters are emboldened.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.BoldItalic
member.summary: Bit mask for Bold and Italic flags.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Oblique
member.summary: Font contains oblique characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.ItalicOrOblique
member.summary: Bit mask for Italic and Oblique flags.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Underscore
member.summary: Characters are underscored.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Strikeout
member.summary: Characters are overstruck.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Negative
member.summary: Characters have their foreground and background reversed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Hollow
member.summary: Hollow (outlined) characters, otherwise they are solid.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.LastResort
member.summary: If set, indicates that the glyphs encoded in the cmap subtables are simply generic symbolic representations of code point ranges and don’t truly represent support for those code points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.Collection
member.summary: Indicates if the font was loaded from .ttc or .otc font collection.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.NoBitmapCache
member.summary: Prevents using bitmap glyph cache and OpenType embedded bitmaps.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.NoGlyphInstructions
member.summary: Indicates if the TrueType font has no glyph instructions.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.DisableHinting
member.summary: Prevents executing TrueType instructions.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontFlags.LongOffsets
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontStyle
member.summary: Specifies the emulated style of the font, if necessary.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontStyle.Regular
member.summary: Normal text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontStyle.Bold
member.summary: Bold text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontStyle.Italic
member.summary: Italic text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontStyle.BoldItalic
member.summary: Applied both the Bold and Italic attributes.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths
member.summary: Specifies the preferred glyph widths (generally used in CJKV fonts).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.Default
member.summary: Don't apply any special glyph-width features.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.ProportionalWidths
member.summary: Replace glyphs set on uniform widths (typically full or half-em) with proportionally spaced glyphs using the 'pwid' font feature.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.ProportionalAlternateWidths
member.summary: Respace glyphs designed to be set on full-em widths, fitting them onto individual (more or less proportional) horizontal widths ('palt').

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.FullWidths
member.summary: Replace glyphs set on other widths with glyphs set on full (usually em) widths using the 'fwid' font feature.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.HalfWidths
member.summary: Replace glyphs other than half an em, with glyphs on half-em (en) widths using the 'hwid' font feature.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.AlternateHalfWidths
member.summary: Respace glyphs designed to be set on full-em widths, fitting them onto half-em widths using the 'halt' font feature.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.ThirdWidths
member.summary: Replace glyphs on other widths with glyphs set on widths of one third of an em using the 'twid' font feature.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphWidths.QuarterWidths
member.summary: Replace glyphs on other widths with glyphs set on widths of one quarter of an em using the 'qwid' font feature.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags
member.summary: Various flags describing inline objects.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.None
member.summary: Indicates that none of the flags are set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.SidewaysInVerticalText
member.summary: Indicates whether the inline object can appear rotated 90 or -90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.CanBreak
member.summary: Indicates that a line break is allowed before or after the inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.MayNotBreakBefore
member.summary: Indicates that there should be no line break before the inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.MustBreakBefore
member.summary: Indicates that the line break must happen before the inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.BreakBeforeMask
member.summary: Mask for testing the line-breaking behavior before the inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.MayNotBreakAfter
member.summary: Indicates that there should be no line break after the inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.MustBreakAfter
member.summary: Indicates that the line break must happen after the inline object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.InlineObjectFlags.BreakAfterMask
member.summary: Mask for testing the line-breaking behavior after the inline object.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ParagraphAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of paragraph text along the flow direction axis.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ParagraphAlignment.Near
member.summary: The top of the text flow is aligned to the top edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ParagraphAlignment.Far
member.summary: The bottom of the text flow is aligned to the bottom edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ParagraphAlignment.Center
member.summary: The center of the text flow is aligned to the center of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ParagraphAlignment.Justified
member.summary: The lines of text are justified between the top and bottom edges of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ParagraphAlignment.Distributed
member.summary: Same as except the case with a single line which is centered.

member.summary: All text fits into the original (for Split) or the same page (for SplitAndBalance).

member.summary: Unable to split the text without leaving the first part (for Split) or the first page (for SplitAndBalance) empty.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TabStopAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the tab stop alignment options.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TabStopAlignment.Leading
member.summary: Text is aligned to the right of the tab stop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TabStopAlignment.Trailing
member.summary: Text is aligned to the left of the tab stop and extends to the left.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TabStopAlignment.Center
member.summary: Text is centered relative to the tab stop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TabStopAlignment.Separator
member.summary: Characters are aligned to the left of a specified separator.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of paragraph text along the reading direction axis.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextAlignment.Leading
member.summary: The leading edge of the paragraph text is aligned to the leading edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextAlignment.Trailing
member.summary: The trailing edge of the paragraph text is aligned to the trailing edge of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextAlignment.Center
member.summary: The center of the paragraph text is aligned to the center of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextAlignment.Justified
member.summary: Aligns text to the leading side, and also justifies text to fill the lines.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextAlignment.Distributed
member.summary: Justifies all text lines regardless of paragraph breaks.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextDecorations
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the decorations applied to text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextDecorations.None
member.summary: No text decorations are applied.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextDecorations.Strikethrough
member.summary: Strikethrough is applied to the text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TextDecorations.Underline
member.summary: Underline is applied to the text.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TrimmingGranularity
member.summary: Specifies the text granularity used to trim text overflowing the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TrimmingGranularity.None
member.summary: No trimming occurs. Text flows beyond the layout width or height.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TrimmingGranularity.Character
member.summary: Trimming occurs at a character cluster boundary.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TrimmingGranularity.Word
member.summary: Trimming occurs at a word boundary.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition
member.summary: Chooses the relative vertical position for an anchored object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.CharCenter
member.summary: The object center coincides with the anchor line's (character's) center.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.CharTopIn
member.summary: The object top side coincides with the anchor line's (character's) top side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.CharTopOut
member.summary: The object bottom side coincides with the anchor line's (character's) top side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.CharBottomIn
member.summary: The object bottom side coincides with the anchor line's (character's) bottom side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.CharBottomOut
member.summary: The object top side coincides with the anchor line's (character's) bottom side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.MarginTop
member.summary: The object top side coincides with the top margin of the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.MarginCenter
member.summary: The object center coincides with the layout box center.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VerticalPosition.MarginBottom
member.summary: The object bottom side coincides with the bottom margin of the layout box.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.WrapMode
member.summary: Specifies how text lines are broken to avoid text overflowing the layout box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.WrapMode.WordWrap
member.summary: Text lines are broken in accordance with the Unicode line breaking algorithm (see Unicode Standard Annex #14).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.WrapMode.CharWrap
member.summary: Text lines can be broken at the grapheme cluster boundaries (see Unicode Standard Annex #29).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.WrapMode.NoWrap
member.summary: Text lines can not be broken.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags
member.summary: Text format options.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.None
member.summary: Default options.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Bold
member.summary: Bold text (must be equal to 1).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Italic
member.summary: Italic text (must be equal to 2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Strikethrough
member.summary: Strikethrough is applied to the text (must be equal to 4).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Underline
member.summary: Underline is applied to the text (must be equal to 8).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.GlyphWidthMask
member.summary: The mask for preferred glyph-width (must be equal to 0x70).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.TransformToFullWidth
member.summary: Transforms latin text into fullwidth characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Upright
member.summary: Indicates if normally sideways characters should be drawn upright in vertical text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Sideways
member.summary: Indicates if all characters should appear rotated 90 or -90 degrees in vertical text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.FontSizeInGraphicUnits
member.summary: FontSize is specified in graphic units, not in points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.SameSizeForFallback
member.summary: Don't recalculate size of fallback font.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.TextRunAsCluster
member.summary: Indicates if the whole should be considered as single Grapheme Cluster.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Subscript
member.summary: Indicates if the glyphs should be displayed as subscript.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Superscript
member.summary: Indicates if the glyphs should be displayed as superscript.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.SubSuperMask
member.summary: A mask for both Subscript and Superscript flags.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.Hollow
member.summary: Indicates if the glyphs are hollow (outlined), otherwise they are solid.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.UseTypoMetrics
member.summary: Indicates if typographical font metrics are enforced.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.UseVerticalLineGapForSideways
member.summary: Indicates that should be applied to rotated text fragments.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.SkipNormalization
member.summary: Indicates that canonical decomposition, reordering, and composition stages should be omitted.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.NoBitmapCache
member.summary: Prevents using bitmap glyph cache.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.DisableFontHinting
member.summary: Prevents font hinting for TrueType fonts.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.PreventFontSbits
member.summary: Prevents using OpenType embedded bitmaps from the EBDT font table.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.CompareH
member.summary: Flags to compare formats in horizontal text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.CompareV
member.summary: Flags to compare formats in vertical text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.CompareHGpos
member.summary: Flags to compare GPOS fragments in horizontal text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.CompareVGpos
member.summary: Flags to compare GPOS fragments in vertical text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FormatFlags.CompareGsub
member.summary: Flags to compare GSUB fragments.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GaspFlags
member.summary: Flags describing desired rasterizer behavior.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GaspFlags.None
member.summary: Neither, typically ppem>2048.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GaspFlags.GridFit
member.summary: Use gridfitting.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GaspFlags.DoGray
member.summary: Use grayscale rendering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GaspFlags.SymmetricGridFit
member.summary: Use gridfitting with ClearType symmetric smoothing.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GaspFlags.SymmetricSmoothing
member.summary: Use smoothing along multiple axes with ClearType.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphClassDef
member.summary: Сlass values for the GlyphClassDef table.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphClassDef.Unclassified
member.summary: The class zero for unclassified glyphs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.GlyphClassDef.Base

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VdmxCharSet
member.summary: Used to denote cases where the VDMX group was computed based on a subset of the glyphs present in the font file.

member.summary: No subset; the VDMX group applies to all glyphs in the font. This is used for symbol or dingbat fonts.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VdmxCharSet.NoSubsetV1
member.summary: No subset; the VDMX group applies to all glyphs in the font. Used when creating a new font for Windows.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VdmxCharSet.AnsiV0
member.summary: Windows ANSI subset; the VDMX group was computed using only the glyphs required to complete the Windows ANSI character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.VdmxCharSet.AnsiV1
member.summary: The VDMX group applies to all glyphs in the font, should only be used in conjunction with ANSI_CHARSET.

member.summary: Pixel size for the widths (as ppem, measured along the y axis).

member.summary: Maximum width, in pixels.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.FontRevision
member.summary: The revision number set by font manufacturer.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.Flags
member.summary: Font flags (see HeaderFlags).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.UnitsPerEm
member.summary: Valid range is from 16 to 16384. This value should be a power of 2 for fonts that have TrueType outlines.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.BoundingBoxWidth
member.summary: The width of the all glyph bounding box.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.BoundingBoxHeight
member.summary: The height of the all glyph bounding box.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.XMin
member.summary: X minimum for all glyph bounding boxes.
member.remarks: The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.YMin
member.summary: Y minimum for all glyph bounding boxes.
member.remarks: The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.XMax
member.summary: X maximum for all glyph bounding boxes.
member.remarks: The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.YMax
member.summary: Y maximum for all glyph bounding boxes.
member.remarks: The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.MacStyle
member.summary: Font style for Mac (see HeaderMacStyle).
member.remarks: Note that the macStyle bits must agree with the 'OS/2' table fsSelection bits. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Microsoft Windows.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.HeaderTable.LowestRecPpem

member.summary: Subtables contain information for vertical or horizontal text, and can contain kerning values or minimum values.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable
member.summary: Contains information for vertical or horizontal text, and can contain kerning values or minimum values.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.PairCount
member.summary: Number of kerning pairs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.KerningPairs
member.summary: The left-hand glyph and the right-hand glyph in the kerning pairs: (leftGlyphID << 16) | rightGlyphID.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.KerningValues
member.summary: The kerning value for the above pair, in FUnits.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than zero, the characters will be moved apart. If this value is less than zero, the character will be moved closer together.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.HorizontalData
member.summary: If set, the table has horizontal data, if not set, it has vertical data.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.MinimumValues
member.summary: If set, the table has minimum values, if not set, the table has kerning values.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.CrossStream
member.summary: If set, kerning is perpendicular to the flow of the text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.ReplaceAccumulatedValue
member.summary: If set, the value in this table should replace the value currently being accumulated.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.KerningTable.KernSubtable.IndexOfPair(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns the index of a given key pair, or -1.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.MergeTable.MergeEntries
member.summary: The merge-entry data array is a 2D table of entries for glyph-class pairs (see MergeFlags).
member.remarks: Each entry is a uint8 value, and the total size of the data is MergeClassCount^2. The data are organized as MergeClassCount number of rows each having MergeClassCount number of column entries.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.MergeTable.ClassDefTables
member.summary: An array of class definition tables.
member.remarks: The MergeEntries are provided for merge classes 0 to MergeClassCount – 1.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.Font.UseBitmapCache
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if the Bitmap Glyph Cache is enabled.
This property affects text drawing on GcBitmapGraphics only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.Font.EnableHinting
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if the TrueType glyph hinting instructions can be executed.
By default hinting instructions are enabled, but note that only some TrueType fonts include such instructions. For fonts that do not include glyph instructions, this property will always return false.
Also note that this property affects text drawing on GcBitmapGraphics only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.Font.TypographicFamilyName
member.summary:
Gets the typographic family grouping name.
The typographic family grouping doesn't impose any constraints on the number of faces within it, in contrast with the 4-style family grouping.

member.summary:
Get the value indicating the visual weight (degree of blackness or thickness of strokes) of the characters in the font.
Values from 1 to 1000 are valid.

member.summary:
Get the value indicating a relative change from the normal aspect ratio (width to height ratio) for the glyphs in a font.
Values from 1 (UltraCondensed) to 9 (UltraExpanded) are expected.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CffOperand.AboveMe
member.summary: Gets or sets an operand that is above the current one in the stack.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CffOperand.BelowMe
member.summary: Gets or sets an operand that is below the current one in the stack.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CffOperand.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the operand.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CffOperand.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current operand.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CffOperand.IsInteger
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the operand is an integer value.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.CffOperand.IntValue
member.summary: Gets the integer value of the operand (not applicable to float operands).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontLink
member.summary: Describes a reference to used as fallback or EUDC font for a specific base font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontLink.Font
member.summary: Gets a used as linked fallback or EUDC font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontLink.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets a value specifying the scale factor applied to size of the base font when the linked font is used instead.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables
member.summary: Represents a font instance with a set of OpenType tables, and provides methods allowing to retrieve information contained in those tables.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Font
member.summary: Gets the associated with this instance.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.LoadTables(GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TableTag[])
member.summary: Loads the missing OpenType tables specified with an array of tags.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.UnloadTables(GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TableTag[])
member.summary: Unloads OpenType tables specified with an array of tags.
member.returns: True if one or more tables were unloaded, False otherwise.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.IsLoaded(GrapeCity.Documents.Text.TableTag)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the specified OpenType table is loaded.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Base
member.summary: Provides information used to align glyphs of different scripts and sizes in a line of text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Cbdt
member.summary: Embedded color bitmap glyph data.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Cff
member.summary: This table contains a compact representation of a PostScript Type 1, or CIDFont.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Cff2
member.summary: This table represents a Compact Font Format (CFF) Version 2.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Colr
member.summary: Adds support for multi-colored glyphs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Cpal
member.summary: Contains unparsed data for the CPAL table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Ebdt
member.summary: Embedded monochrome or grayscale bitmap glyph data.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Ebsc
member.summary: Contains unparsed data for the EBSC table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Gdef
member.summary: The Glyph Definition (GDEF) table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Gpos
member.summary: The Glyph Positioning table (GPOS).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Gsub
member.summary: The Glyph Substitution Table (GSUB).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Jstf
member.summary: Provides font developers with additional control over glyph substitution and positioning in justified text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Ltsh
member.summary: Defines the point at which it is reasonable to assume linearly scaled advance widths on a glyph-by-glyph basis.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Merg
member.summary: Specifies whether certain glyph pairs or sequences should be composed together before antialiasing is performed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Os2
member.summary: A set of metrics that are required in OpenType fonts.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Svg
member.summary: Contains SVG descriptions for some or all of the glyphs in the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Vdmx
member.summary: Defined to avoid grid fitting the entire font to determine the correct height.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Vorg
member.summary: Specifies the y coordinate of the vertical origin of every glyph in the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Cmap
member.summary: Defines the mapping of character codes to the glyph index values used in the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Cvt
member.summary: Contains a list of values that can be referenced by TrueType instructions.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Fpgm
member.summary: Similar to the CVT program, except that it is only run once, when the font is first used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Gasp
member.summary: Contains information which describes the preferred rasterization techniques for the typeface when it is rendered on grayscale-capable devices.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Glyf
member.summary: This table contains information that describes the glyphs in the font in the TrueType outline format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Hdmx
member.summary: The Horizontal Device Metrics table stores integer advance widths scaled to particular pixel sizes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Head
member.summary: This table gives global information about the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Hhea
member.summary: Contains information for horizontal layout.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Hmtx
member.summary: Provides horizontal metrics for each glyph — advance widths and left side bearings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Kern
member.summary: Contains the values that control the inter-character spacing for the glyphs in a font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Maxp
member.summary: Establishes the memory requirements for this font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Name
member.summary: Allows multilingual strings to be associated with the OpenType font file.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Post
member.summary: Contains additional information needed to use TrueType or OpenType fonts on PostScript printers.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Prep
member.summary: TrueType instructions that will be executed before each glyph is interpreted.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Sbix
member.summary: Provides access to bitmap data in a standard graphics format, such as PNG, JPEG or TIFF.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Vhea
member.summary: Contains information needed for vertical fonts.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.Vmtx
member.summary: Specifies the vertical spacing for each glyph in a vertical font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.CpalDraw
member.summary: Parsed data for the CPAL table without the ability to serialize.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GlyfDraw
member.summary: Same as Glyf but without the ability to serialize.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.EblcPpem
member.summary: Glyph IDs and pixels per em for embedded bitmaps.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.AppendReferencedGlyphs(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.UInt16})
member.summary: Appends glyphs which are referenced by the glyphs in the specified HashSet.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.MapChar(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the glyph index for the specified Unicode character.
Depends on 'cmap' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.TryMapChars(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Maps the specified set of Unicode characters to the font glyphs and fills the set of successfully mapped characters.
Depends on 'cmap' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetUnicodeChars
member.summary:
Returns a HashSet with all supported Unicode characters.
Depends on 'cmap' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetExtenderGlyphs(GrapeCity.Documents.Text.ScriptTag)
member.summary:
Gets the array of glyph indices, such as Arabic kashidas, that a client may insert to extend the length of the line for justification.
Depends on 'JSTF' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetGlyphVertOriginY(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets the y coordinate of a glyph's vertical origin, in design units.
Depends on 'vmtx', 'glyf', 'VORG' tables.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetGlyphWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the advance width for the given glyph.
Depends on 'hmtx' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetGlyphHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the advance height for the given glyph.
Depends on 'vmtx' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetGlyphName(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns name of the glyph from "post" table.
Depends on 'post' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.TryGetGlyphIndex(System.String,System.UInt16@)
member.summary:
Tries to return index of the glyph by its name from "post" table.
Depends on 'post' table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetPaletteEntryLabels
member.summary:
Returns the array of user interface strings associated with each palette entry.
Depends on 'CpalDraw', 'name' tables.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetPalettes
member.summary:
Returns the array of font palettes (from CPAL table).
Depends on 'CpalDraw', 'name'(optionally) tables.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Text.FontTables.GetUnicodeRanges
member.summary:
Returns a string with the list of supported Unicode ranges.
Depends on 'OS/2' table.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Util.DWSystemFontProvider.FontSuffix
member.summary: In DirectWrite fonts like "Arial Narrow" or "Arial Black" (and similar) should be processed differently in compare with GDI. In GDI these fonts specified via name "Arial Narrow" BUT in DirectWrite they should be specified with name "Arial" and Narrow should be specified via Stretch property of DirectWrite font. This class holds suffix like "Narrow", "Condenced" etc and DW font properties and used to convert GDI name like "Arial Narrow" to DW family name "Arial" and DW.FontStretch.Condenced.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.AcroForm.SigFlagsConstants.SignaturesExist
member.summary: If set, the document contains at least one signature field. This flag allows a viewer application to enable user interface items (such as menu items or pushbuttons) related to signature processing without having to scan the entire document for the presence of signature fields.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.AcroForm.SigFlagsConstants.AppendOnly
member.summary: If set, the document contains signatures that may be invalidated if the file is saved (written) in a way that alters its previous contents, as opposed to an incremental update. Merely updating the file by appending new information to the end of the previous version is safe (see Section G.6, “Updating Example”). Viewer applications can use this flag to present a user requesting a full save with an additional alert box warning that signatures will be invalidated and requiring explicit confirmation before continuing with the operation.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags
member.summary: Defines possible values of the property.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a check box. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Pushbutton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.RadiosInUnison
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) If set, a group of radio buttons within a radio button field that use the same value for the on state will turn on and off in unison; that is if one is checked, they are all checked. If clear, the buttons are mutually exclusive (the same behavior as HTML radio buttons).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field can contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the field’s text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheck
member.summary: If set, text entered in the field is not spell-checked.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: If set, the field does not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than fits within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text is accepted.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Comb
member.summary: Meaningful only if the MaxLen entry is present in the text field dictionary and if the Multiline, Password, and FileSelect flags are clear. If set, the field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.RichText
member.summary: If set, the value of this field should be represented as a rich text string.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Edit
member.summary: If set, the combo box includes an editable text box as well as a drop-down list; if clear, it includes only a drop-down list. This flag is meaningful only if the flag is set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the field’s option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications. Viewers should simply display the options in the order in which they occur in the Opt array.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: If set, more than one of the field’s option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.AcroForms.FieldFlags.CommitOnSelChange
member.summary: If set, the new value is committed as soon as a selection is made with the pointing device. This option enables applications to perform an action once a selection is made, without requiring the user to exit the field. If clear, the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.

member.summary: Indicates whether field names and values are submitted using an HTTP GET request, otherwise they are submitted using a POST request.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.HtmlFormFormatFlags.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: Indicates whether the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action are transmitted as part of the form data.
member.remarks: The coordinate values are relative to the upper-left corner of the field’s rectangle. They are represented in the data in the format name.x = xval & name.y = yval where name is the if present; otherwise, name is the field name. If the value of the is a single space character, both the name and the dot following it are suppressed, resulting in the format x = xval & y = yval

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.FDFFormatFlags
member.summary: Defines possible values of property.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.FDFFormatFlags.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF file includes the contents of all incremental updates to the underlying PDF document, as contained in the Differences entry in the FDF dictionary. If clear, the incremental updates are not included.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.FDFFormatFlags.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF file includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document. If clear, markup annotations are not included.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.FDFFormatFlags.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: Meaningful only when the flag is set. If set, it includes only those markup annotations whose matches the name of the current user, as determined by the remote server to which the form is being submitted. This allows multiple users to collaborate in annotating a single remote PDF document without affecting one another’s annotations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.FDFFormatFlags.ExclFKey
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF excludes the F entry.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.FDFFormatFlags.EmbedForm
member.summary: If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF is a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.PDFFormatFlags
member.summary: Defines possible values of property.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Actions.ActionSubmitForm.PDFFormatFlags.GetMethod
member.summary: Indicates whether the PDF document submitted using an HTTP GET request, otherwise it is submitted using a POST request.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags
member.summary: Specifies the various characteristics of an .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.None
member.summary: Empty.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Invisible
member.summary: Do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such an unknown annotation using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Hidden
member.summary: Do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available. In cases where screen space is limited, the ability to hide and show annotations selectively can be used in combination with appearance streams to display auxiliary pop-up information similar in function to online help systems.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Print
member.summary: Print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen. This can be useful, for example, for annotations representing interactive pushbuttons, which would serve no meaningful purpose on the printed page.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: Do not scale the annotation’s appearance to match the magnification of the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation rectangle) remains fixed, regardless of the page magnification.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: Do not rotate the annotation’s appearance to match the rotation of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle remains in a fixed location on the page, regardless of the page rotation.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoView
member.summary: Do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: Do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is ignored for widget annotations; its function is subsumed by the ReadOnly flag of the associated form field.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Locked
member.summary: Do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotation’s contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: Invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events. A typical use is to have an annotation that appears only when a mouse cursor is held over it.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: Do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle
member.summary: Specifies the possible line ending styles.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.None
member.summary: No line ending.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.Square
member.summary: A square filled with the annotation’s interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.Circle
member.summary: A circle filled with the annotation’s interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.Diamond
member.summary: A diamond shape filled with the annotation’s interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.OpenArrow
member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.ClosedArrow
member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the OpenArrow style and connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotation’s interior color, if any.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.Butt
member.summary: A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.ROpenArrow
member.summary: Two short lines in the reverse direction from OpenArrow.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.RClosedArrow
member.summary: A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from ClosedArrow.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.LineEndingStyle.Slash
member.summary: A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself

member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity value to be used in painting the annotation. This value applies to all visible elements of the annotation in its closed state (including its background and border) but not to the pop-up window that appears when the annotation is opened.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationBase.UpdateCoords
member.summary: Called after reading annotation from PDF stream when it added to the page, used to update its coords so they become relative to the top-left corner of the page.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationBase.OnPropertyAffectingAppearanceChanged
member.summary: Called when property affecting annotation's appearance was changed. This method sets to true, so annotation's appearance properties will be automatically regenerated when document saved.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.AnnotationBase.OnAppearancePropertyChanged
member.summary: Called when property defining annotation's appearance was changed. This method sets to false so annotation's appearance properties will NOT automatically regenerated.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.Appearance
member.summary:
Represents the appearance of an annotation in normal, rollover and down states.
In the simplest case the appearance can be defined by a single specified by the property.
In more complex cases it can be defined as a subdictionary specified by the property. For example, an annotation representing an interactive check box might have two appearance states named On and Off.
See PDF specification for details.

member.summary: Represents a free text annotation that displays text directly on a page. Unlike an ordinary text annotation (see ), a free text annotation has no open or closed state. Instead of being displayed in a pop-up window, the text is always visible.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the structure that defines the numerical differences between two rectangles: the and an inner rectangle contained within that rectangle. The inner rectangle is where the ’s text should be displayed.
Note that if this rectangle is not specified then is used as the text rectangle.

Six numbers [ x1 y1 x2 y2 x3 y3 ] represent the starting, knee point, and ending coordinates of the line in default user space. A negative value indicates the opposite direction.

member.summary: Gets or sets a non-negative number representing the length of the leader line offset, which is the amount of empty space between the endpoints of the annotation and the beginning of the leader lines.

member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal offset along the annotation line from its midpoint, with a positive value indicating offset to the right and a negative value indicating offset to the left.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.StampAnnotation
member.summary: Represents an annotation that displays text or graphics intended to look as if they were stamped on the page with a rubber stamp.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.StampAnnotation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.StampAnnotation.Icon
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string specifying the name of an icon used to display the annotation.
The PDF specification provides a predefined set of icons, those are provided by the enumeration.
In practice though this entry often contains names of custom icons specific to the application that created the document, hence this property is a string so it can accommodate arbitrary values.
To assign a predefined icon, use code like the following:
Icon = StampAnnotationIcon.Approved.ToString();

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an image should be scaled proportionally.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.ImageScale.Position
member.summary:
Gets or sets the position of an image.
The two numbers between 0.0 and 1.0 indicate the fraction of leftover space to allocate at the left and bottom of an image. A value of (0.0, 0.0) positions the image at the bottom-left corner of the button rectangle. A value of (0.5, 0.5) centers it within the rectangle.
This value is used only if the image is scaled proportionally.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Annotations.ImageScale.IgnoreBorder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a button's appearance should be scaled to fit fully within the bounds of the annotation without taking into consideration the line width of the border.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Audio.WaveFormatEncoding.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Audio.WaveFormatEncoding.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Pdf.Audio.WaveStreamReader.GetStreamInfo(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses WAV stream and returns object describing it.

members.member:
The logical order of bits within a byte.
1 = MSB-to-LSB 2 = LSB-to-MSB (flipped)
Uncompressed mode flag: 1 if uncompressed, 0 if not.
EOL padding flag: 1 if fill bits have been added before an EOL such that the EOL ends on a byte boundary, 0 otherwise.
Invokes the superclass method and then sets instance variables on the basis of the metadata set on this decompressor.

member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.
